intro: Tragia klingii, commonly known as the silverleaf tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Tragia klingii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
